name: pass
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: pass
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to go past something or someone or move in relation to it, him, or her

example.eg: I passed him on the stairs this morning.
example.egtrans: 今天早上我在楼梯上与他擦肩而过。

example.eg: You should only pass a slower vehicle if it is safe to do so.
example.egtrans: 只有在安全的情况下，你才应该超越较慢的车辆。

example.eg: If you pass a supermarket, could you get me some milk?
example.egtrans: 你若是路过超市的话，帮我买些牛奶好吗？

example.eg: I was just passing by (= going past the place where you are), so I thought I'd drop in for a chat.
example.egtrans: 我正好路过，所以想进来聊聊。

example.eg: A momentary look of anxiety passed across his face.
example.egtrans: 他脸上闪过一丝焦虑的神情。

example.eg: A cloud passed over the sun.
example.egtrans: 一朵云飘过，遮住了太阳。

trans_examp.trans_en: to go past a particular point in time

example.eg: Don't buy goods that have passed their sell-by date.
example.egtrans: 不要购买过了销售期限的商品。

trans_examp.trans_en: to go past something by being greater in amount or degree

example.eg: The company's turnover is expected to pass the $10 million mark by the end of this year.
example.egtrans: 公司营业额预计将在今年年底超过一千万美元大关。

trans_examp.trans_en: If you say a state or feeling will pass, you mean it will disappear.

example.eg: Don't worry, his depression is only temporary - it'll soon pass.
example.egtrans: 别担心，他的消沉只是暂时的——很快就会过去。

dsense.name: pass
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to be successful in an exam, course, etc.

example.eg: Guess what? I've passed my driving test!
example.egtrans: 你猜怎么着？我通过驾驶考试了！

example.eg: The exam is so hard that only five percent of all applicants pass.
example.egtrans: 考试太难了，所有考生中只有5%通过。

dsense.name: pass
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give something to someone

example.eg: Could you pass the salt please?
example.egtrans: 你能把盐递给我吗？

example.eg: I asked if I could see the letter, so she passed it to me reluctantly.
example.egtrans: 我问能不能看看那封信，她很不情愿地递给了我。

example.eg: Gerald passed me the note./Gerald passed the note to me.
example.egtrans: 杰拉尔德把便条递给了我。

example.eg: Genes are the means by which parents' characteristics are passed on to their children.
example.egtrans: 基因是一系列遗传指令，父母的特征通过它们遗传给子女。

trans_examp.trans_en: In sports, if you pass the ball, you kick, throw, or hit it to someone in your team.
If you pass money, you give someone false or stolen money without telling them.

example.eg: I haven't trusted him since he passed me a forged $100 bill.
example.egtrans: 自从他给了我一张100美元的假钞后我就不信任他了。

example.eg: She was arrested for passing stolen cheques.
example.egtrans: 她因使用偷窃的支票而被捕。

dsense.name: pass
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: When time passes, it goes past.

example.eg: Time seems to pass (by) so slowly when you're bored.
example.egtrans: 百无聊赖时，时间似乎过得很慢。

example.eg: I was a little worried about the party, but the evening passed without any great disasters.
example.egtrans: 我有点为晚会担心，但是一晚上过去了，并没出什么大纰漏。

trans_examp.trans_en: If you pass a period of time, you do something to stop yourself being bored during that period.

example.eg: The visitors pass their days swimming, windsurfing, and playing volleyball.
example.egtrans: 游客们通过游泳、冲浪和打排球来消磨时间。

dsense.name: pass
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of an official group of people) to give approval to something, especially by voting to make it law

example.eg: The government passed a law to restrict the sale of guns.
example.egtrans: 政府通过了一项限制枪支买卖的法律。

example.eg: The food supplement had been passed as safe for human consumption.
example.egtrans: 这种食品添加剂通过了检测，适合食用。

dsense.name: pass
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to express a judgment or opinion about something, especially someone else's behaviour

example.eg: As a convicted criminal, he's in no position to pass judgment (on the rest of us).
example.egtrans: 他是已定罪的罪犯，没资格（对我们其他人）品头论足。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to say officially, as a judge, what a criminal's official punishment will be

dsense.name: pass
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to remove waste from the body

example.eg: to pass urine
example.egtrans: 排尿

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to have blood in your urine or faeces (= solid waste)

example.eg: If you pass blood, you should go and see your doctor.
example.egtrans: 如果你便血的话应该去看医生。

dsense.name: pass
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to choose not to play in a part of a game or not to answer a question in a quiz
trans_examp.trans_cn: （牌戏中不出牌或竞赛中不回答问题时的用语）过

dsense.name: pass
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to change from one state to another

example.eg: Wax passes from solid to liquid when you heat it.
example.egtrans: 蜡受热后会从固体变成液体。

name: pass
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: pass
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a successful result in an exam

example.eg: Jon Hill achieved two grade A passes at A-level.
example.egtrans: 乔‧希尔在高级证书考试中取得了 A 等成绩。

trans_examp.trans_en: a successful result in a course or exam for which the student will not be given a mark

example.eg: I got a pass in my Literature course.
example.egtrans: 我修习的文学课程考试及格了。

dsense.name: pass
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a movement of the ball from one player to another member of the same team in a team sport

dsense.name: pass
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an official document or ticket showing that you have the right to go somewhere or use a particular form of transport

example.eg: a bus pass
example.egtrans: 公共汽车乘车证

example.eg: a boarding pass
example.egtrans: 登机牌

example.eg: My guest pass allows me to use the club's facilities free of charge.
example.egtrans: 我有贵宾证，可以免费使用该俱乐部的设施。

trans_examp.trans_en: a document that allows a student to leave a class for a particular reason
trans_examp.trans_cn: 免课证（允许某一学生因为特殊原因离开课堂）

example.eg: She had a pass to go to the library.
example.egtrans: 她得到许可离开课堂去图书馆。

dsense.name: pass
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a path or road between or over mountains

example.eg: a mountain pass
example.egtrans: 山口

dsense.name: pass
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a difficult or unpleasant condition

example.eg: If I'd been aware things had reached such a pass, I'd have told the police.
example.egtrans: 我要是知道事情已到了这步田地，早就报警了。

example.eg: It's come to a pretty pass (= it's a bad situation) when you can't even have a few quiet drinks with some friends.
example.egtrans: 当你连和几个朋友安静地喝几杯也不行时，处境真是糟透了。

dsense.name: pass
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to speak to or touch someone in a way that shows you would like to start a sexual relationship with them
